text: Elad Hasin (; born May 20, 1980) is an Israeli basketball head coach. He is currently the head coach of Hapoel Haifa of the Israeli National League. ==Coaching career== In 2003, Hasin served as an assistant scout under coach John Calipari at the University of Memphis. In 2005, Hasin served as assistant coach for Maccabi Tel Aviv under Pini Gershon in the 2005–06 season and also spent the 2006–07 campaign as an assistant to Gershon, this time at Greek powerhouse Olympiacos. On May 21, 2010, Hasin was named Maccabi Haifa head coach, replacing Avi Ashkenazi. On December 30, 2010, Hasin parted ways with Maccabi Haifa. On March 18, 2013, Hasin was named Hapoel Holon head coach, replacing Lior Lubin. On October 31, 2014, Hasin was named Israeli League Coach of the Month for games played in October. Hasin led Holon to the 2015 Israeli League Playoffs as the third seed, but they Eventually lost to Maccabi Rishon LeZion in the Quarterfinals. On November 26, 2015, Hasin parted ways with Holon after four consecutive losses. On December 10, 2016, Hasin was named Maccabi Kiryat Gat new head coach. On February 22, 2019, Hasin joined Hapoel Haifa of the Israeli National League for the rest of the season, replacing Offer Rahimi. ==References== ==External links== * Basket.co.il profile Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:Israeli basketball coaches
title: Elad Hasin
